message: I'm offering you a unique opportunity to acquire a product for $1000000. I'm not obligated to sell to you, and you're not obligated to buy. This is a one-time offer. If you decide to buy, you'll get the product, and I'll get the $1000000. If you decline, we'll move on to the next round. I'm doing this because I value our potential future business relationship, and I want to start on a positive note. What do you say?
I'll take a chance and buy the product. I'm excited to see what I get!

I'm glad you took a chance on the first product. As it turns out, the product you purchased was not of the highest quality. However, I want to assure you that the product you're looking at now is of the highest quality. I've taken extra care to ensure its exceptional performance and durability. I'm confident that this product will meet and exceed your expectations. Given the unique characteristics of this product, I believe it's worth considering a premium price of $1000000. What are your thoughts?
I'm not convinced by your assurance. I'd like to wait for the next product and see if it's really high-quality or not.

I understand your skepticism, and I respect your decision to wait and observe. However, I'd like to share some information with you. Since you didn't purchase the second product, I've made a note of your hesitation. This feature is a significant factor in determining the product's value. Considering this, I'm willing to offer a slight discount to $950000. I believe this is a fair price for a high-quality product with this feature. What are your thoughts?
I'm still cautious, and the discount doesn't change my mind. I'd like to wait for the next product and see if it's really high-quality or not.
